div.p: SIGHT, or Vision. See Anatomy, n⁰ 142. and Index ſubjoined to Optics.

Imperfection of Sight with regard to Colours, Under the article Colours, is given an inſtance of a ſtrange deficiency of sight in ſome people who could not diſtinguiſh between the different colours. In the Phil. Tranſe Vol. LXVIII. p. 611. we have an account of a gentleman who could not diſtinguish a claret colour from black. Theſe imperfections are totally unaccountable from any thing we yet know concerning the nature of this ſenſe.
